data.title: Excellent Art Gallery
data.text: Great art gallery in downtown Napa. They have a variety of artists and mediums making it a great place to walk around or to look if you are looking for art to buy. We purchased several napa scenic photographs on canvas. They are lovely. We have been in there several times over the years and they do a nice job of bringing in new artists to keep it interesting.

data.title: Great Romantic Realism
data.text: We make it a point to visit this gallery whenever we're in Napa.  It appeared that the Gallery had made a complete recovery from the devastating Napa Earthquake.  The paintings and sculptures always impress us and are a joy to look at.  The Gallery is managed by Linda Cordair who is extremely courteous, helpful, and knowledgeable.  On this occasion we also got to meet her husband, Quent, who is on his way to becoming a noted national author with his Idolatry series.  We enjoyed visiting with both of them and will be sure to stop in on our next trip to Napa.

data.title: MUST SEE ART GALLERY
data.text:
OK my fabulous Facebook friends....
When you are in Napa go downtown to the West End On first Street by Franklin and visit this wonderful art gallery Full of treasures.
The people who own it have done a great job putting it all together... Paintings and sculptures and limited edition prints on canvas are available at reasonable prices.
Go check it out and I guarantee you will be inspired.....
And the people who own it are really nice folks...
If you bring Linda a cup of coffee  or a glass of wine, you will have a new friend....🍷
 Well behaved children and browsers are welcome ...😉
Easy payments are available as are layawsys...Just ask....
 Stop in at your leisure and you will be inspired.
Thanks for visiting downtown Napa

data.title: Beautiful art still exists! FREE to view at your leisure!
data.text:
My daughter and I both loved this gallery and found it one of our favorite stops in Napa Valley. We were pretty sick of "modern art" peices that looked like something WE could have created!  THIS serene gallery, with classy background music, no-pressure-whatsoever sales, a special incentive to help new buyers, and even a special treat for "Facebook-likers"
was a breathing point on our 2-day quest to absorb Napa Valley.  This place is inhabited by stunning paintings and sculptures.  The wine-focused paintings (which appeared photographic in perfect depiction) were a must-see for Art/wine lovers!

data.title: Lovely respite
data.text: A refuge from wine bars & tourist merchandise. Quent Cordair displays a wide array of exquisite artwork. We are fortunate to have them in Napa!

data.title: Incredible
data.text:
These are some of the most stunningly gorgeous and philosophically inspirational art pieces I've ever had the joy to set eyes upon. Walking through the gallery doors is like entering a world-class spa: a serene and welcoming place to relax and cleanse the mind and soul.

The gallery is a comfortable, quiet and bright space, and features incredible artists such as Chris Dellorco, Bryan Larsen and Serge Marshennikov. The management is very friendly and helpful. Free parking is conveniently located on 2nd Street, just behind the gallery.

data.title: Amazing Gallery
data.text: I live in Washington, DC and I frequently visit art museums to see the masters. The artists in the Cordair Gallery is at the same level. The paintings and sculpture there is absolutely stunning.  I could have spent the entire day soaking it in.  If you do one thing in Napa, visit this gallery!

data.title: Inspirational and Inviting
data.text: When I found the gallery online over a decade ago, I immediately "mapquested" how far it was from my home at the time.  The hundreds of miles between us made me want to move closer. Seriously. The gallery itself is the closest thing to magic I know.  There are few places on Earth where I feel both so grounded and inspired.  It was in this gallery that I first had an emotional reaction to visual art.  I continue to be touched and delighted by what I see here.  Thank you!

data.title: A gorgeous art gallery in Napa!
data.text: Quent Cordair Fine Art is a gorgeous art gallery in Napa, which focuses primarily on sculptures, paintings, and drawings created in the romantic realism style. That is to say, the art features "a rebirth of comprehensibility, beauty, romanticism and stylization to contemporary subject matter." When I visit the gallery, curator Linda Cordair always makes me feel comfortable and at home. There are guides and information in each section of the gallery so that you can view and shop at your own pace. Some of my favorite artists include Bryan Larsen, Thomas Arvid, Serge Marshennikov, and Bill Mack, The gallery also features art and fiction by Quent Cordair himself, as well as affordable, limited-edition prints. For those of you who may not think you can afford fine art in your home or business, the gallery has Club Cordair, a program in which you can begin investing in art and enjoying art purchase discounts. For a virtual tour, visit cordair.com.

data.title: Great find in Napa
data.text: This gallery is worth a visit for Bryan Larsen's work alone, but it has so much more. It's a joy to visit a gallery with beautiful, heroic, life affirming art. It makes me wish I had more walls and a fatter wallet.

data.title: Nice Art Gallery in Downtown Napa - Quent Cordair Fine Art
data.text:
We went to Quent Cordair Fine Art Gallery in the downtown area of Napa.  The art gallery is named after the artist and owner.

We liked seeing the art.  Their artistic style is Romantic Realism.   They have paintings, sculptures, and drawings.

data.title: A must-see for art lovers
data.text: During a recent trip to Napa, my husband and I went to this gallery...twice. For lovers of Romantic art, this gallery is a must-see. The gallery clearly takes care to curate talented artists, whose works inspire. It was such a rich collection that we needed to return to see all the marvels. Highly recommended.

data.title: Great on art, Poor on politics.
data.text: A recent business trip revealed some great office art, my inquiries linked it to this Napa art gallery. The website displayed a lot of the theme we were looking for in our admin offices. We have recently expanded into a new location with room for more than houseplants. I found the same items on the Facebook page, but Twitter revealed something unexpected. We review our client relations weekly and the art purchase was brought up for discussion this morning. After review, our company founder refused to fund anything that would support business ethics such as public display of political opinions. She was right, our company cannot afford to be linked to personal politics. We wish this incredible gallery continued success but have decided not to purchase from them.

data.title: Coming Home Just Got Better!
data.text: Attracting a gallery as amazing as Quent Cordair Fine Art Gallery is a milestone for the reincarnation of downtown Napa.  I grew up in Napa and visit frequentl.  This gallery is always on my "must do" list.  The collection is world-class; Linda and Quent are passionate about the artists they feature.  They make the art approachable, and love to educate.  I came away with a better understanding and appreciation of Romantic Realism.  Fortunately, they make purchasing these amazing pieces easy even for those of us who haven't won any lotteries lately.  Indulge, enjoy - you'll be glad you did!

data.title: Beautiful Art Gallery
data.text: Quent Cordair Fine Art is hands down our favorite art gallery! With a great location in downtown Napa, this gallery is surrounded by beauty and filled with absolutely gorgeous pieces. The collection is stunning and inspiring and features a diverse array of media and subject.

data.title: Wonderful Art
data.text: We recently visited the Quent Cordair Fine Art Gallery in Napa CA.  Located on First St in downtown Napa, it's very easy to find.  First impressions are gleaned from the window displays which feature a taste of what's to be found inside, a veritable treasure trove of paintings and sculptures, not the least of which is a larger that life sculpture titled "Self Made Man" which greets you upon entry.  The staff is extremely knowledgeable and helpful without being too forward.  The manager Linda and her Artist/Writer husband Quent are some of the finest people we've met.  We enjoyed browsing the many rooms and alcoves of the gallery, each divided by subject or artist.  The art is classified as romantic realism which we found truly inspiring.

data.title: A gem of a gallery
data.text:
Today I visited the art gallery of Quent Cordair Fine Art and I was very surprised! The art was beautiful, inspiring and uplifting. Compared to most galleries, that feature pretentious splatters of paint on a canvas, Quent Cordair Fine Art had art that depicted things that I can actually identify and react to: beautiful women, couples in loving embraces, happy children, delicious wines, mythical stories... the list goes on and on! 

 If you love art and are going to visit Napa, a trip to Quent Cordair Fine Art is a must!
